job title: Upsream Senior Scientist, Biologics Process Development and Commercialization
job description:
As part of the Merck Manufacturing Division, within Global Vaccines and Biologics Commercialization (GVBC), the Biologics Process Development and Commercialization (BPDC) department provides the technical process leadership and laboratory capabilities in support of late stage pipeline and commercial manufacturing processes for biologics (therapeutic proteins). For pipeline programs, BPDC supports various commercialization activities, including technology transfer to internal and external manufacturing sites, process validation, and authoring of regulatory submissions. For commercial programs, including but not limited to KEYTRUDA® and ZINPLAVA®, the scope includes site-to-site process transfers, manufacturing investigations and trend evaluations, process enhancements, next generation process (i.e., post approval) development and characterization, process validation, and regulatory submission authoring.

BPDC department is now seeking a talented individual supporting late stage and commercial biologics program activities, under the general scientific and administrative direction of the Director in Upstream Processing and working in conjunction with internal and external partners. The individual will demonstrate scientific, experimental and tech transfer skills focusing on uptream processing.

Technical Scope:

Serve as Subject Matter Expert on cell culture media and upstream raw materials evaluation, characterization, implementation, supply, and investigation.
Support upstream teams on late stage process development, characterization, technology transfer, and validation with line-of-sight for licensure and commercialization.
Collaborate with downstream, process analytics, and other functional teams in both R&D and manufacturing to advance biologics pipeline.
Conduct laboratory-scale and/or manufacturing scale studies to support commercial process validation, characterization, and investigation evaluations, including studies performed either in-house or externally.
Author required regulatory and technical documentation. Ensure that process/product are developed and documented according to standard Merck practices.
Qualifications

Education Minimum Requirement:

PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biological Engineering, Biochemistry, Cell Biology, or related biological/engineering sciences or a MS with a minimum of 4 years of experience or a BS with a minimum of 6 years of experience.
Required Experience and Skills:
Solid experience in development, manufacturing and analytical testing of chemically defined media and supplements.
Solid experience on mammalian cell culture process development, scale-up, technology transfer and manufacturing.
Hands-on experience with advanced statistical and computational tools (e.g. Design of Experiments, multivariate data analysis, etc).

Preferred Experience and Skills:
Experience with cell culture medium specification development, manufacturing scale-up (liquid and powder), validation, and commercialization.
Experience with investigation and lot-to-lot variability assessment for cell culture medium and other upstream raw materials.
Experience with applying Systems Biology tools (e.g. transcriptomics, metabolomics, proteomics, and other -omics approaches) to understand cell biology and metabolism.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, passion for scientific excellence, and capability to deliver complex objectives under compressed timelines.
Experience authoring CMC sections of IND/BLA/MAA and other regulatory documents.
Solid track record of scientific contributions and project accomplishments, with ability to deliver high quality presentations/publications
